when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to say goodbye when leaving.
example: さようなら、また明日！ (sayounara, mata ashita!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: この庭は美しいです。 (kono niwa wa utsukushii desu.) - This garden is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe the size of large objects.
example: あの建物はとても大きいです。 (ano tatemono wa totemo ookii desu.) - That building is very big.

when_to_say: Used to describe the size of small objects.
example: この箱は小さいです。 (kono hako wa chiisai desu.) - This box is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼の車は速いです。 (kare no kuruma wa hayai desu.) - His car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something moving at a slow pace.
example: 彼の歩き方は遅いです。 (kare no arukikata wa osoi desu.) - His walking is slow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the animal dog.
example: あの犬はかわいいです。 (ano inu wa kawaii desu.) - That dog is cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the animal cat.
example: 猫が机の上にいます。 (neko ga tsukue no ue ni imasu.) - There is a cat on the table.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of eating.
example: 私は寿司を食べます。 (watashi wa sushi o tabemasu.) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of drinking.
example: 彼は水を飲みます。 (kare wa mizu o nomimasu.) - He drinks water.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of going somewhere.
example: 私は学校へ行きます。 (watashi wa gakkou e ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of coming.
example: 友達が家に来ます。 (tomodachi ga ie ni kimasu.) - My friend comes to my house.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of seeing or watching.
example: 私は映画を見ます。 (watashi wa eiga o mimasu.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of listening or hearing.
example: 音楽を聞くのが好きです。 (ongaku o kiku no ga suki desu.) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of reading written material.
example: 本を読むのは楽しいです。 (hon o yomu no wa tanoshii desu.) - Reading books is enjoyable.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of writing.
example: 私は手紙を書く。 (watashi wa tegami o kaku.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or high cost.
example: このビルはとても高いです。 (kono biru wa totemo takai desu.) - This building is very tall.

when_to_say: Used to describe low cost or affordability.
example: この店の服は安いです。 (kono mise no fuku wa yasui desu.) - The clothes in this shop are cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe high temperatures in weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold temperatures in weather.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe something recently made or acquired.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita.) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aged or outdated.
example: この家は古いです。 (kono ie wa furui desu.) - This house is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe a large, open space.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe a tight or small space.
example: この道は狭いです。 (kono michi wa semai desu.) - This road is narrow.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not complicated.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This problem is simple.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that requires effort to solve.
example: この宿題は難しいです。 (kono shukudai wa muzukashii desu.) - This homework is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is amusing or captures interest.
example: この本は面白いです。 (kono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - This book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe aesthetic beauty.
example: 美しい景色が見えます。 (utsukushii keshiki ga miemasu.) - A beautiful view can be seen.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of considerable size.
example: この犬はとても大きいです。 (kono inu wa totemo ookii desu.) - This dog is very big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of small size.
example: この猫は小さいです。 (kono neko wa chiisai desu.) - This cat is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or mental strength.
example: 彼はとても強いです。 (kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe a lack of physical or mental strength.
example: その橋は弱いです。 (sono hashi wa yowai desu.) - That bridge is weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or timeliness.
example: 彼は走るのが早いです。 (kare wa hashiru no ga hayai desu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe a lack of speed or being behind schedule.
example: この時計は遅いです。 (kono tokei wa osoi desu.) - This clock is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or silent atmosphere.
example: この部屋は静かです。 (kono heya wa shizuka desu.) - This room is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a bustling or cheerful atmosphere.
example: この市場は賑やかです。 (kono ichiba wa nigiyaka desu.) - This market is lively.

when_to_say: Used to describe something useful or accessible.
example: このアプリは便利です。 (kono apuri wa benri desu.) - This app is convenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not useful or accessible.
example: この場所は不便です。 (kono basho wa fuben desu.) - This location is inconvenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone or something that is caring or soft.
example: 彼女はとても優しい人です。 (kanojo wa totemo yasashii hito desu.) - She is a very kind person.

when_to_say: Used to describe a person or situation that is demanding.
example: 先生は厳しいですが、公平です。 (sensei wa kibishii desu ga, kouhei desu.) - The teacher is strict but fair.

when_to_say: Used to describe enjoyable activities or moments.
example: 昨日のパーティーは楽しかったです。 (kinou no paatii wa tanoshikatta desu.) - Yesterday's party was fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe a feeling of loneliness or solitude.
example: 彼がいなくて寂しいです。 (kare ga inakute sabishii desu.) - I feel lonely without him.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of significant height or cost.
example: この時計は高いです。 (kono tokei wa takai desu.) - This watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe items that are inexpensive.
example: この店の商品は安いです。 (kono mise no shouhin wa yasui desu.) - The products in this shop are cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of limited length or duration.
example: この文章は短いです。 (kono bunshou wa mijikai desu.) - This sentence is short.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of considerable length or duration.
example: この映画は長いです。 (kono eiga wa nagai desu.) - This movie is long.

when_to_say: Used to describe objects that are not new.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe objects that are recently made or acquired.
example: 新しい服を買いました。 (atarashii fuku o kaimashita.) - I bought new clothes.

when_to_say: Used to describe weather or temperature as being hot.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe weather or temperature as being cold.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is entertaining or humorous.
example: この映画は面白いです。 (kono eiga wa omoshiroi desu.) - This movie is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that induces fear.
example: その話は怖いです。 (sono hanashi wa kowai desu.) - That story is scary.

when_to_say: Used to express joy or happiness.
example: プレゼントをもらって嬉しいです。 (purezento o moratte ureshii desu.) - I’m happy to receive a present.

when_to_say: Used to express sadness or sorrow.
example: 悲しい映画を見ました。 (kanashii eiga o mimashita.) - I watched a sad movie.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or the timing of an action.
example: 彼は走るのが早いです。 (kare wa hashiru no ga hayai desu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe a slow pace or late timing.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color blue.
example: 空は青いです。 (sora wa aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color red.
example: 花は赤いです。 (hana wa akai desu.) - The flower is red.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color white.
example: 雪は白いです。 (yuki wa shiroi desu.) - Snow is white.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color black.
example: 彼の車は黒いです。 (kare no kuruma wa kuroi desu.) - His car is black.

when_to_say: Used to describe strength, either physical or metaphorical.
example: 彼は強い選手です。 (kare wa tsuyoi senshu desu.) - He is a strong athlete.

when_to_say: Used to describe lack of strength, either physical or metaphorical.
example: その壁は弱いです。 (sono kabe wa yowai desu.) - That wall is weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe weight or metaphorical burden.
example: この箱は重いです。 (kono hako wa omoi desu.) - This box is heavy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something lightweight or insignificant.
example: このカバンは軽いです。 (kono kaban wa karui desu.) - This bag is light.

when_to_say: Used to describe something with a large area or space.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something with limited area or space.
example: この道は狭いです。 (kono michi wa semai desu.) - This road is narrow.

when_to_say: Used to describe a tall mountain.
example: 富士山は高い山です。 (fujisan wa takai yama desu.) - Mount Fuji is a tall mountain.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of small size.
example: この犬は小さいです。 (kono inu wa chiisai desu.) - This dog is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe something recently created, discovered, or introduced.
example: 新しい本を買いました。 (atarashii hon o kaimashita.) - I bought a new book.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old or outdated.
example: 古い車があります。 (furui kuruma ga arimasu.) - There is an old car.

when_to_say: Used to describe calmness or silence.
example: この町は静かです。 (kono machi wa shizuka desu.) - This town is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a bustling or lively environment.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not complicated.
example: この仕事は簡単です。 (kono shigoto wa kantan desu.) - This task is simple.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging or hard to do.
example: この質問は難しいです。 (kono shitsumon wa muzukashii desu.) - This question is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe a clear, cloudless sky.
example: 今日は青い空が広がっています。 (kyou wa aoi sora ga hirogatteimasu.) - A blue sky is spreading today.

when_to_say: Used to describe beauty or cleanliness.
example: この庭はきれいです。 (kono niwa wa kirei desu.) - This garden is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone’s vitality or health.
example: 彼女は元気です。 (kanojo wa genki desu.) - She is energetic.

when_to_say: Used to describe a car with high speed.
example: 速い車を運転したいです。 (hayai kuruma o unten shitai desu.) - I want to drive a fast car.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness in movement or speed.
example: この列車は遅いです。 (kono ressha wa osoi desu.) - This train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: 美しい景色を見ました。 (utsukushii keshiki o mimashita.) - I saw a beautiful view.

when_to_say: Used to describe something engaging or fun.
example: この本は面白いです。 (kono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - This book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather or temperature.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or temperature.
example: 夏は暑いです。 (natsu wa atsui desu.) - Summer is hot.

when_to_say: Used to describe a house of small size.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is useful or easy to use.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that causes inconvenience.
example: その場所は不便です。 (sono basho wa fuben desu.) - That location is inconvenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe something close in distance.
example: 駅は近いです。 (eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is near.

when_to_say: Used to describe something far in distance.
example: その学校は遠いです。 (sono gakkou wa tooi desu.) - That school is far.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is enjoyable or fun.
example: 今日は楽しい日でした。 (kyou wa tanoshii hi deshita.) - Today was a fun day.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike for something.
example: 私は野菜が嫌いです。 (watashi wa yasai ga kirai desu.) - I dislike vegetables.

when_to_say: Used to describe something expensive or high in height.
example: その時計は高いです。 (sono tokei wa takai desu.) - That watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is inexpensive.
example: このシャツは安いです。 (kono shatsu wa yasui desu.) - This shirt is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of large size.
example: この家は大きいです。 (kono ie wa ookii desu.) - This house is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of small size.
example: 私は小さいカメラを持っています。 (watashi wa chiisai kamera o motteimasu.) - I have a small camera.

when_to_say: Used to indicate something is not the same or is different.
example: 私たちは違う意見を持っています。 (watashitachi wa chigau iken o motteimasu.) - We have different opinions.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is the same.
example: この二つのペンは同じです。 (kono futatsu no pen wa onaji desu.) - These two pens are the same.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is difficult or challenging.
example: この問題は難しいです。 (kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is simple or easy.
example: その説明は簡単でした。 (sono setsumei wa kantan deshita.) - The explanation was simple.

when_to_say: Used to express admiration or amazement.
example: この映画はすごいです。 (kono eiga wa sugoi desu.) - This movie is amazing.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fast or happening early.
example: 彼は早いですね。 (kare wa hayai desu ne.) - He is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something happening later than expected.
example: 私は遅く帰ります。 (watashi wa osoku kaerimasu.) - I will go home late.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of long length.
example: その映画は長いです。 (sono eiga wa nagai desu.) - That movie is long.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of short length.
example: この話は短いです。 (kono hanashi wa mijikai desu.) - This story is short.

when_to_say: Used to describe a quiet atmosphere or environment.
example: この公園は静かです。 (kono kouen wa shizuka desu.) - This park is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is precious or important.
example: この本は大切です。 (kono hon wa taisetsu desu.) - This book is important.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is annoying or troublesome.
example: その作業は面倒です。 (sono sagyou wa mendou desu.) - That task is troublesome.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is easy, comfortable, or relaxing.
example: その仕事は楽です。 (sono shigoto wa raku desu.) - That job is easy.

when_to_say: Used when making a decision or choice.
example: 何を食べるか決めましたか？ (nani o taberu ka kimemashita ka?) - Have you decided what to eat?

when_to_say: Used when considering something or thinking about something.
example: 彼はよく考えます。 (kare wa yoku kangaemasu.) - He thinks a lot.

when_to_say: Used when discovering or finding something.
example: 私は鍵を見つけました。 (watashi wa kagi o mitsukemashita.) - I found the key.

when_to_say: Used when recalling or memorizing something.
example: 単語を覚えるのは難しいです。 (tango o oboeru no wa muzukashii desu.) - Memorizing words is difficult.

when_to_say: Used when passing on information or telling someone something.
example: 彼にメッセージを伝えてください。 (kare ni messeeji o tsutaete kudasai.) - Please convey the message to him.

when_to_say: Used when attempting or trying something.
example: 新しいレシピを試してみました。 (atarashii reshipi o tameshite mimashita.) - I tried a new recipe.

when_to_say: Used when you forget something.
example: 宿題を忘れました。 (shukudai o wasuremashita.) - I forgot my homework.

when_to_say: Used when calling someone or summoning.
example: 名前を呼んでください。 (namae o yonde kudasai.) - Please call my name.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the act of using something.

when_to_say: Used when holding or possessing something.
example: 私はスマートフォンを持っています。 (watashi wa sumaato fon o motteimasu.) - I have a smartphone.

when_to_say: Used when giving something to someone.

when_to_say: Used when granting forgiveness to someone.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone's lack of skill in an activity.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is relaxing or easy to handle.

when_to_say: Used to describe something amazing or excellent.
example: 素晴らしいアイデアです！ (subarashii aidea desu!) - It's a wonderful idea!

when_to_say: Used to describe someone caring or gentle in nature.
example: 彼は優しい人です。 (kare wa yasashii hito desu.) - He is a kind person.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or emotional strength.
example: 彼はとても強いです。 (kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or emotional weakness.
example: 私は力が弱いです。 (watashi wa chikara ga yowai desu.) - I am physically weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe something recently created or acquired.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something not new or aged.
example: この家は古いです。 (kono ie wa furui desu.) - This house is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of small size.
example: 小さい犬がいます。 (chiisai inu ga imasu.) - There is a small dog.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of large size.
example: この箱は大きいです。 (kono hako wa ookii desu.) - This box is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe a peaceful or silent environment.
example: 図書館は静かです。 (toshokan wa shizuka desu.) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a bustling and lively atmosphere.
example: この街は賑やかです。 (kono machi wa nigiyaka desu.) - This town is lively.

when_to_say: Used to describe something useful or practical.
example: このアプリは便利です。 (kono apuri wa benri desu.) - This app is convenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that causes inconvenience or is impractical.
example: その場所は少し不便です。 (sono basho wa sukoshi fuben desu.) - That place is a bit inconvenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe a comfortable temperature or a warm feeling.
example: 春の天気は暖かいです。 (haru no tenki wa atatakai desu.) - Spring weather is warm.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather or temperature.
example: 今日はとても寒いです。 (kyou wa totemo samui desu.) - It’s very cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or temperature.
example: 夏は暑いです。 (natsu wa atsui desu.) - Summer is hot.

when_to_say: Used to describe pleasantly cool weather.
example: 秋の夜は涼しいです。 (aki no yoru wa suzushii desu.) - Autumn nights are cool.

when_to_say: Used to describe a location or distance that is far away.
example: その町はここから遠いです。 (sono machi wa koko kara tooi desu.) - That town is far from here.

when_to_say: Used to describe something located nearby.
example: 駅はここから近いです。 (eki wa koko kara chikai desu.) - The station is close to here.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or cost.
example: そのビルは高いです。 (sono biru wa takai desu.) - That building is tall.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is short in height or low in level.
example: その椅子は低いです。 (sono isu wa hikui desu.) - That chair is low.

when_to_say: Used to describe doing something quickly.
example: 速く走ってください。 (hayaku hashitte kudasai.) - Please run quickly.

when_to_say: Used to describe something moving slowly or happening late.
example: 彼は歩くのが遅いです。 (kare wa aruku no ga osoi desu.) - He walks slowly.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of great importance or value.
example: 家族はとても大切です。 (kazoku wa totemo taisetsu desu.) - Family is very important.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is easy or not complicated.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This problem is simple.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is challenging or hard to do.
example: 日本語は難しいです。 (nihongo wa muzukashii desu.) - Japanese is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something physically bright or someone's cheerful personality.
example: 彼女は明るい性格です。 (kanojo wa akarui seikaku desu.) - She has a cheerful personality.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical darkness or a gloomy atmosphere.
example: 部屋が暗いです。 (heya ga kurai desu.) - The room is dark.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that brings joy or fun.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです。 (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu.) - Traveling is very fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of sadness.
example: その映画は悲しいです。 (sono eiga wa kanashii desu.) - That movie is sad.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is lively or in good health.
example: 彼はとても元気です。 (kare wa totemo genki desu.) - He is very energetic.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is good at something.
example: 彼女は歌が上手です。 (kanojo wa uta ga jouzu desu.) - She is good at singing.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is not good at something.
example: 彼は料理が下手です。 (kare wa ryouri ga heta desu.) - He is bad at cooking.

when_to_say: Used to describe something essential or needed.
example: これは必要な情報です。 (kore wa hitsuyou na jouhou desu.) - This is necessary information.

when_to_say: Used to describe a peaceful or noise-free environment.
example: 図書館は静かです。 (toshokan wa shizuka desu.) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe something or someone being loud and annoying.
example: 子供たちはうるさいです。 (kodomotachi wa urusai desu.) - The children are noisy.

when_to_say: Used to describe a state of happiness or contentment.
example: 私はとても幸せです。 (watashi wa totemo shiawase desu.) - I am very happy.

when_to_say: Used to express concern or worry about something.
example: 心配しないでください。 (shinpai shinaide kudasai.) - Please don’t worry.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is useful or makes life easier.
example: スマホはとても便利です。 (sumaho wa totemo benri desu.) - Smartphones are very convenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of unease or nervousness.
example: 明日の試験が不安です。 (ashita no shiken ga fuan desu.) - I’m anxious about tomorrow’s exam.

when_to_say: Used to describe something engaging or humorous.
example: その本は面白いです。 (sono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - That book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something frightening or scary.
example: その映画は怖いです。 (sono eiga wa kowai desu.) - That movie is scary.
